description.p: A Physical_quantity_value is a type of Independent_property that is a physical_quantity value.

note.p: A Physical_quantity_value can be a member of a continuous Physical_quantity_space such as 'mass'. In this case, a Physical_quantity_value possessed by a Product_as_individual or Individual_activity or is known only to within a tolerance.
A range of possible values for a Physical_quantity_value can be specified by indicating a Physical_quantity_range in which it is contained.

description.note: The entity type Physical_quantity_value defined in this part of ISO 10303 is identical to the entity type property defined in ISO 15926-2.

description.p: A Physical_quantity_symmetry is a type of Independent_property that indicates a symmetry of an Physical_quantity_value with respect to orientation in space.
A Physical_quantity_symmetry is valid only for instances of Physical_quantity_value which are second or higher order tensors.
description.note: Standard instances of Physical_quantity_symmetry for second and fourth order tensors are specified in Standard_physical_quantity_symmetry.

description.p: A Physical_quantity_symmetry_by_library_reference is a Physical_quantity_symmetry that is defined by reference to an external library.
description.note: Standard instances of Physical_quantity_symmetry for second and fourth order tensors are specified in Standard_physical_quantity_symmetry.

explicit.name: item_id
explicit.description: a text string that identifies the the Physical_quantity_symmetry_by_library_reference.

explicit.name: source_id
explicit.description: a text string that identifies the supplier of definition of the Physical_quantity_symmetry_by_library_reference.

description.p: A Space_for_physical_quantity is a relationship between an Physical_quantity_value and a Physical_quantity_space that indicates the physical phenomenon for the Physical_quantity_value.

ul.li: the Physical_quantity_value that is 20 degrees Celsius; and

example.p: that indicates the physical phenomenon, is a Space_for_physical_quantity.

explicit.name: relating
explicit.description: the Physical_quantity_space that indicates the physical phenomenon.

explicit.name: related
explicit.description: the Physical_quantity_value that has the physical phenomenon indicated.

description.p: A Standard_physical_quantity_symmetry is a type of Physical_quantity_symmetry_by_library_reference that is defined within this part of ISO 10303.
The standard instances of Physical_quantity_symmetry for second and fourth order tensors specified by this part of ISO 10303 are shown in Table 1.

td.p: symmetric second order tensor in two dimensions with 3 independent values - see ISO 10303-104:2000
symmetric second order tensor in two dimensions with 1 independent value - see ISO 10303-104:2000
symmetric second order tensor in three dimensions with 6 independent values - see ISO 10303-104:2000
symmetric second order tensor in three dimensions with 1 independent value - see ISO 10303-104:2000
symmetric second order tensor in three dimensions with 3 independent values - see ISO 10303-104:2000
symmetric fourth order tensor in two dimensions with 6 independent values - see ISO 10303-104:2000
symmetric fourth order tensor in two dimensions with 2 independent values - see ISO 10303-104:2000
symmetric fourth order tensor in three dimensions with 2 independent values - see ISO 10303-104:2000
symmetric fourth order tensor in three dimensions with 3 independent values - see ISO 10303-104:2000
symmetric fourth order tensor in three dimensions with 5 independent values - see ISO 10303-104:2000
symmetric fourth order tensor in three dimensions with 9 independent values - see ISO 10303-104:2000
symmetric fourth order tensor in three dimensions with 13 independent values - see ISO 10303-104:2000
symmetric fourth order tensor in three dimensions with 21 independent values - see ISO 10303-104:2000

description.p: These standard instances of class are identified using the methodology of IEC 61360, where:

ul.li: the code is as specified in Table 1;
the supplier is this part of ISO 10303 identified as 'ISO-TS-10303-1099'.

where.label: valid_standard_class
where.description: The supplier shall be 'ISO-TS-10303-1099', and the code shall be one of those listed in Table 1.

description.p: A Symmetry_for_physical_quantity is a relationship between a Physical_quantity_value and a Physical_quantity_symmetry that indicates the symmetry of the Physical_quantity_value.

ul.li: the Physical_quantity_value that is an isotropic strain of 0.0005; and

example.p: that indicates the nature of the physical quantity value, is a Symmetry_for_physical_quantity.

explicit.name: relating
explicit.description: the Physical_quantity_symmetry that is the symmetry.

explicit.name: related
explicit.description: the Physical_quantity_value that has the symmetry.
